scenarios.description: While walking to class, you see someone unknowingly drop a $20 bill. You’d have to run to return it, but you could really use the money yourself... What will you do?

choices.text: Run to catch up to them, even if it makes you late for class
Call out to them. If they don’t hear you, keep the money.
Keep the money. They don’t even realize they've lost it.

scenarios.description: The person you helped thanks you gratefully, and invites you to church. You’re exhausted from exams, but she seems lonely. What do you do?

choices.outcome: You meet Pastor John and the church community.

scenarios.description: You keep the $20 but feel uneasy. Later, you decide to go to your local coffee shop, and you see the same person, they appear to be short by a dollar. What do you do?

choices.text: Give them $20 you picked up earlier
'They're only short by a dollar... I'll just give them 1'

scenarios.description: You spend the $20 but feel guilty. Later, you see Sarah at a coffee shop. She looks upset. What do you do?

choices.outcome: Sarah forgives you and invites you to church.

scenarios.description: At church, Pastor John asks for volunteers to help at a homeless shelter. You’re already stretched thin, but the need is great.

choices.outcome: You meet Michael, a man struggling with addiction.
You feel a sense of missed opportunity.

scenarios.description: You skip church to study but feel uneasy. Sarah texts you later, asking if you’d like to join a Bible study group.

choices.outcome: You reconnect with Sarah and the church.

choices.text: Decline and focus on your studies

scenarios.description: Sarah opens up about her struggles. She asks if you’d pray with her. What do you do?

choices.text: Pray with her and offer support

scenarios.description: You ignore Sarah, but her face haunts your thoughts. A friend suggests you pray about it. What do you do?

choices.outcome: You feel a sense of peace and clarity.

choices.text: Ignore the guilt and move on

scenarios.description: Sarah forgives you and invites you to church. You’re hesitant but feel a sense of relief. What do you do?

choices.outcome: You reconnect with the church community.

choices.text: Decline but promise to stay in touch
choices.outcome: You feel a sense of unresolved tension.

scenarios.description: You avoid Sarah, but the guilt lingers. A classmate invites you to a party to distract yourself. What do you do?

choices.outcome: You feel temporarily distracted but empty.

choices.text: Stay home and reflect on your choices
choices.outcome: You feel a sense of conviction.

endings.title: Full of Grace
endings.message: Your heart mirrors Christ’s love—sacrificial, relentless, and transformative.

endings.title: Growing In Love
endings.message: You care deeply but sometimes hesitate. Keep seeking His kingdom first!
endings.verse: 1 John 4:19 - 'We love because He first loved us.'

endings.title: Seeking Light
endings.message: You're on the path but need courage to surrender fully. His grace is enough!
endings.verse: 1 John 4:19 - 'We love because He first loved us.'

endings.title: Broken Vessel
endings.message: You’re on the path but need courage to surrender fully. His grace is enough!
endings.verse: 'Return to me, and I will restore you.' (Jeremiah 15:19)
